review: Stick works extremely well right out of the box. I was using an old Roku for watching Amazon Prime, but had problems with buffering. Sometimes, a show would restart every few minutes with the reloading bar slowly progressing across the screen. My son-in-law told my about Fire TV Stick, so I read up on it on Amazon. Info said it had lotsa storage, so for such a low price, I said what the heck. I was not disappointed, so far. However, I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5, because the product lacks a detailed manual. The very brief instructions that come in the box will get you started watching movies and shows, but does not tell you how to set up more complex operations like mirroring your phone or tablet to your TV, or flinging favorite apps to free up your small screen for other uses.So, I ordered a manual from Kindle for $2.99. What a disappointment. This "manual" was nothing more than a poorly written sales brochure that didn't give any step by step instructions about more complex features. The "manual" seemed to have been written by some 3rd world high school student having English as a second language. Here's some advice for Amazon marketing: put a real manual in the box and adjust the price accordingly.
